comments:
Description:
  If user choose a string such as "Bill" to "Time", "Date". It will throw exception. Although it's not available to trans this string to a Time value.It'd better not to throw a exception.

Step to reproduce:
1. use the attache CSV file and new a flat file data source
2. choose the column "CUSTOMNAME" and set its type to "Time" or "Date"
3. preview it in dataset editor.

Actual result:
Get an excetion and other columns can't be previewed

Excepted result:
Don't throw exception and other columns can be previewed

Error log:

org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Cannot get the date value from column: 1
Convert to date fails. Source:Clerver/Theodore

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.odaconsumer.ResultSet.getDate(ResultSet.java:291)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.odaconsumer.ResultSet.fetch(ResultSet.java:162)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.OdiAdapter.fetch(OdiAdapter.java:140)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.RowResultSet.next(RowResultSet.java:91)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.ExpandableRowResultSet.next(ExpandableRowResultSet.java:62)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.SmartCacheHelper.populateData(SmartCacheHelper.java:278)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.SmartCacheHelper.initInstance(SmartCacheHelper.java:250)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.SmartCacheHelper.initOdaResult(SmartCacheHelper.java:138)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.SmartCacheHelper.getResultSetCache(SmartCacheHelper.java:83)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.cache.SmartCache.<init>(SmartCache.java:51)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.pass.PassUtil.populateOdiResultSet(PassUtil.java:100)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.pass.PassUtil.pass(PassUtil.java:66)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.pass.PassManager.doSinglePass(PassManager.java:123)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.pass.PassManager.pass(PassManager.java:83)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.pass.PassManager.populateResultSet(PassManager.java:65)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.ResultSetPopulator.populateResultSet(ResultSetPopulator.java:210)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.transform.CachedResultSet.<init>(CachedResultSet.java:69)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.DataSourceQuery.execute(DataSourceQuery.java:501)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.PreparedOdaDSQuery$OdaDSQueryExecutor.executeOdiQuery(PreparedOdaDSQuery.java:330)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.QueryExecutor.execute(QueryExecutor.java:743)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ServiceForQueryResults.executeQuery(ServiceForQueryResults.java:181)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.QueryResults.getResultIterator(QueryResults.java:137)

	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.data.ui.dataset.ResultSetPreviewPage.populateRecords(ResultSetPreviewPage.java:431)

	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.data.ui.dataset.ResultSetPreviewPage.access$200(ResultSetPreviewPage.java:83)

	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.data.ui.dataset.ResultSetPreviewPage$5.run(ResultSetPreviewPage.java:380)

	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Caused by: org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.OdaException: Convert to date fails. Source:Clerver/Theodore

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.util.DateUtil.toDate(DateUtil.java:174)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.util.DateUtil.toDate(DateUtil.java:207)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.util.DateUtil.toDate(DateUtil.java:112)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.ResultSet.stringToLongDate(ResultSet.java:473)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.ResultSet.stringToDate(ResultSet.java:380)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.ResultSet.getDate(ResultSet.java:185)

	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.consumer.helper.OdaResultSet.getDate(OdaResultSet.java:520)

	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.odaconsumer.ResultSet.getDate(ResultSet.java:285)

If there are OdaExceptions thrown when a String type data is converted to Data, Time and Timestamp type, this OdaException will be caught in ResultSet, and it will be set to null, instead of throwing out this exception. All the data that fails to be converted will not be displayed in the preview page of DataSetEditor.

A new Test case was added in ResultSetTestBase.java for the case above.

traces.message: Cannot get the date value from column: 1 Convert to date fails. Source:Clerver/Theodore
